p: Tea seed oil is a waste product of tea production that has also been considered as a possible CBA, when enzymatically interesterified, with the potential to reduce fat bloom in chocolate ( Zarringhalami et al., 2010). Sensory analysis showed that products with CB substituted with up to 10% w/w with this CBA has acceptable sensory properties as interesterified tea seed oil does not cause any undesirable change to CB crystallization behaviour ( Zarringhalami et al., 2010). This compatibility with CB may be due to high levels of oleic acid ( Sarmah and Das, 2018). Tea seed oil is also high in linoleic acid, which can provide health benefits ( Sarmah and Das, 2018).
